name: Decimal expansion of (362880*e^10 - 3265920*e^9 + 11612160*e^8 - 20744640*e^7 + 19595520*e^6 - 9450000*e^5 + 2064384*e^4 - 157464*e^3 + 2304*e^2 - e) / 362880.
comment: Expected number of picks from a uniform [0,1] distribution needed to first exceed a sum of 10.
reference: J. V. Uspensky, Introduction to Mathematical Probability, New York: McGraw-Hill, 1937.
link: Daniel Mondot, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10001
formula: Equals Sum_{k=0..n} (-1)^k * (n-k+1)^k * exp(n-k+1) / k! for n = 9 (Uspensky, 1937, p. 278).
author: _Daniel Mondot_, Mar 12 2025

name: Decimal expansion of e^4 - 3*e^3 + 2*e^2 - e/6.
comment: Expected number of picks from a uniform [0,1] needed to first exceed a sum of 4.
reference: J. V. Uspensky, Introduction to Mathematical Probability, New York: McGraw-Hill, 1937.
link: Daniel Mondot, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Uniform Sum Distribution
formula: Equals Sum_{k=0..n} (-1)^k * (n-k+1)^k * exp(n-k+1) / k! for n = 3 (Uspensky, 1937, p. 278).
mathematica: RealDigits[ E^4 - 3E^3 + 2E^2 - E/6, 10, 111][[1]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 05 2003 *)
program: (PARI) subst(x^4-3*x^3+2*x^2-x/6, x, exp(1)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 06 2016
author: Brian Dunfield (brian.dunfield(AT)sympatico.ca), Dec 05 2003
ext: Edited and extended by _Robert G. Wilson v_ and _Ray Chandler_, Dec 07 2003

name: Triangular array of coefficients multiplied by n! of polynomials in e. These give the expected number of trials needed for the sum of uniform random variables from the interval [0,1] to exceed n+1.
comment: Expected number of uniform random choices of X from interval[0,1] so that their sum exceeds ...
reference: J. Derbyshire, "Prime Obsession: Bernhard Riemann and the Greatest Unsolved...", Henry Press, 2003, footnote on page 366.
J. V. Uspenski, "Introduction to Mathematical Probability", McGraw Hill, 1937, p. 278.
link: Daniel Mondot, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5049
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Uniform Sum Distribution.
formula: T(n,k) = (-1)^k*n!*(n+1-k)^k/k!; k-th coefficient of n-th row for n >= 0 and k >= 0.
mathematica: Table[n!*CoefficientList[f[n], E] // Reverse // Most, {n, 0, 9}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 05 2013 *)
program: for n in (0..5): print(A089087_row(n))  # _Peter Luschny_, May 03 2013
author: Brian Dunfield (brian.dunfield(AT)sympatico.ca), Dec 04 2003
ext: Corrected and extended by _Vladeta Jovovic_, Dec 05 2003
